data.event: In 1859, a hunting party explored the area, including a small tributary of the Saline River which led them to a site abundant in water, timber, and bison.

event.title: opened under the name Paradise in 1875

data.event: The first post office in the area opened under the name Paradise in 1875.
In 1887, the Union Townsite Company established a town on the north side of the creek northwest of the post office, naming it Ivamar after Iva Marr, the daughter of a local rancher.

event.title: relocated to Ivamar the next year

data.event: The Paradise post office relocated to Ivamar the next year, but kept its name.
As a result, the town came to be known by both names; in 1891, the Union Pacific Railroad listed its rail stop there as Paradise with Ivamar in parentheses.
Ivamar incorporated in 1924 and finally changed its name to Paradise.
